intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. sublanigerum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a creeping rootstock and produces numerous flowering stems that bear small, clustered flowers. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from other forms of Hieracium hypochoeroides.
